metadata.synopsis: Expanded evil branches for Dark Urge players taking control of the Netherbrain and deciding what comes next.

43.text: *A thousand thousand respiring things lie below, pointing up at you, gasping their last.*
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: From atop the Netherbrain, the Dark Urge looks down towards the streets below.InternalNodeContext: Outcome if a Dark Urge player

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *A thousand thousand respiring things lie below, pointing up at you, gasping their last.*
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their love interest and companions, if any are present.

17.text: We could have had victory. We could have had each other. Instead you have chosen madness.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their love interest and companions, if any are present.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: We could have had victory. We could have had each other. Instead you have chosen madness.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark urge reaches forward to kiss their love interest one last time, but there is a dagger between them as well.

65.speaker: Player
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark urge reaches forward to kiss their love interest one last time, but there is a dagger between them as well.

58.text: I... I am glad it was you. No other blade would have sufficed.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I... I am glad it was you. No other blade would have sufficed.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I... I'm coming to you, Lady Shar. Embrace me.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I... I thought we were going to save each other...

63.speaker: Player
63.text: You made me want to live...

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I should have killed you when I had the chance...

45.speaker: Player
45.text: No... no, this can't be... I can't - you can't... no...

48.speaker: Player
48.text: No... We were meant to do this together...

28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You do not want to see what is to come. Death is my reward for your service.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: If not already killed, LOVE INTEREST, if present, is the last to go. One last look, and over they go. DARK URGE smiles.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *Time for the final act. Your tragedy has become mankind's.*
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: If not already killed, LOVE INTEREST, if present, is the last to go. One last look, and over they go. DARK URGE smiles.

10.text: *Time for the final act. Your tragedy has become mankind's.*
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionics overcome the compaions. Horror washes over their faces, but they walk to the edge nonetheless, and step into the void.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Time for the final act. Your tragedy has become mankind's.*
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge goes to the edge of the brain, and 'falls' off - looking like they're committing suicide initially from the way it's framed - but they will actually fly in the next shot

19.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge was actually not in danger, but slowly, serenely, float down to the Gate like the Angel of Death. Perhaps the sky starts to darken even further.

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: The companions are psionically deposited on the ground with a little less grace than durge. Companions give a tragic last look towards Durge, then flee.

55.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The companions are psionically deposited on the ground with a little less grace than durge. Companions give a tragic last look towards Durge, then flee.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge uses the brain to trigger a city-wide dagger explosion. Daggers burst from the chest of civilians, flaming fist, and mindflayers alike. They scream in agony as they float just above the ground, their blood dripping to cover the floor in crimson.

40.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge uses the brain to trigger a city-wide dagger explosion. Daggers burst from the chest of civilians, flaming fist, and mindflayers alike. They scream in agony as they float just above the ground, their blood dripping to cover the floor in crimson.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge uses the brain to trigger a city-wide dagger explosion. Daggers burst from the chest of civilians, flaming fist, and mindflayers alike. They scream in agony as they float just above the ground, their blood dripping to cover the floor in crimson.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dagger explosion is shown through the form of many of the ‘bloody dagger’ effects shown in shots of civilians. Their blood pools beneath their feet.

77.text: *As you think upon the resplendent deaths to come, Father sends a premonition of your red-radiant destiny.*
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge walks past piles of bodies, and some suspended in the daggered explosions created by the brain -

51.text: *As you think upon the resplendent deaths to come, Father sends a premonition of your red-radiant destiny.*
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge psionically yanks the brain back down, causing it to obey

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *As you think upon the resplendent deaths to come, Father sends a premonition of your red-radiant destiny.*
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Durge takes their seat upon the throne once again. Closing their eyes, the Dark Urge vignette blackens the screen.

72.text: *You are the end. The last creature living, with all else felled by your hand. Alone, amidst their gall, at the close of eternity.*
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in to The Dark Urge opening their eyes. They stand alone, in a lake of blood that stretches as far as the eye can see with black void surrounding it. They are walking off into the infinite gore they have pooled, underneath a starless sky.

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *You are the end. The last creature living, with all else felled by your hand. Alone, amidst their gall, at the close of eternity.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Then, and only then, Father will be proud.*

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Run from me when we land. We will meet again at the end of days, when I shall come for you.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Why? You... you betrayed me. You betrayed yourself. Don't do this.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: We were meant to save the world - not damn it. You and I. Together.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: No... we were so close. I stayed by your side. Dark Lady forgive me...

47.speaker: Player
47.text: No... we won. We saved the world. And now you'd doom it again?

60.speaker: Player
60.text: This is the world you wanted? You were better than this. You were better...

76.speaker: Player
76.text: So, you chose this. Over Baldur's Gate, over your friends, over us... you chose this...

83.speaker: Player
83.text: My darling love! You were perfect, my sweet. And now the world is ours to rule.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Everything we fought for, everything we survived... only for you to succumb to madness right as we prevail...? Oak Father forgive us...

5.speaker: Player
5.text: My magnificent love - do you see now what you are capable of? Such terrible beauty. Such beautiful devastation.

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You have no one left to judge you for your sins.*
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their companions, if any are present.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *But aren't we all alone, in the end, when we die?*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *But there is one who deserves the honour of your first death. The beginning of your end.*
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their companions, if any are present.

69.text: The mask of sanity slips away at last. I should have purged you when I had the chance - for the sake of us all.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their companions, if any are present.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: The mask of sanity slips away at last. I should have purged you when I had the chance - for the sake of us all.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: The mask of sanity slips away at last. I should have purged you when I had the chance - for the sake of us all.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: I never expected to die of old age. But if you're waiting for me to beg for my life - we both will.

3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
3.text: You are glorious. And together, we will be magnificent.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: I thought the best of you. The foolish hopes of a man who thought he had an ally - a friend.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: No... we were so close. I stayed by your side. Dark Lady forgive me...

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: No... we won. We saved the world. And now you'd doom it again?

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: So, the beast within you wins at last. And what a prize - a ruined world for a poisoned soul. Congratulations.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: I wish I could blame destiny, or tell myself that Bhaal was just too powerful to resist, but no... No, you chose this.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Maybe this is what I deserve, for all my sins. A front row seat at the end of the world...

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Darling, you were perfect! And now, finally, the whole world lies at our feet.

80.speaker: Minsc
80.text: ...Be still, Boo. Think of our friends.

81.speaker: Minsc
81.text: Do what you will, demon. But you had best do it in one blow.

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: It was all for naught then. We brought the world back from the brink, only for you to cast it all away.

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: I... I thought you'd change. I thought you'd resist. What a fool I was.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You shall soon amass an illithid army to bring slaughter across Faerûn. But now, it is time to unleash Bhaal's adoration upon his beloved city.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Your brain beyond brains calculates precisely how many creatures await death below. Ninety-seven thousand, six hundred and two.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *And two hundred thousand and twelve rats. There is no death too small for Bhaal, after all.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *You are half an Illithid. Half a God. Below the gawking onlookers line up to die.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Your brain, split, possessed, carved, many-times wormed, need think only one thought now. You know the one, Bhaalspawn.*
